description: The trap will be generated when the number of endpoints on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer exceeds the configured threshold.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityThresholdTrap APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsEndpointsCurrent u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacity u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityUpperThresh u 0 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityLowerThresh u 0

description: Number of endpoints currently on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsEndpointsCurrent

description: The maximum number of endpoints allowed on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.This value is based on the installed
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer license(s).
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacity

description: The configured endpoint capacity upper threshold percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityUpperThresh

description: The configured endpoint capacity lower threshold percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityLowerThresh

description: The trap will be generated when the number of endpoints on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer falls below the configured threshold.

event.Summary: SLB endpoint capacity is within threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityThresholdClearTrap APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsEndpointsCurrent u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacity u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityUpperThresh u 0 APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityLowerThresh u 0

description: Number of endpoints currently on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsEndpointsCurrent

description: The maximum number of endpoints allowed on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.This value is based on the installed
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer license(s).
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacity

description: The configured endpoint capacity upper threshold percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityUpperThresh

description: The configured endpoint capacity lower threshold percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBEndpointCapacityLowerThresh

description: The trap will be generated when the number of untrusted endpoints
on the Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer exceeds the configured threshold.

event.Summary: SLB untrusted endpoint capacity threshold exceeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityThresholdTrap APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsCurrent u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsDenied u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsAgedOut u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacity u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityUpperThresh u 0 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityLowerThresh u 0

description: Number of untrusted endpoints currently on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsCurrent

description: The number of untrusted endpoints denied by the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer due to the total number of
untrusted endpoints exceeding the configured maximum allowed.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsDenied

description: The number of untrusted endpoints aged out of the
system because they were not authenticated within the
configured grace period.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsAgedOut

description: The maximum number of untrusted endpoints allowed on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer. This value is a configured percentage
of the maximum endpoint capacity of the system.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacity

description: The configured untrusted endpoint capacity upper threshold
percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityUpperThresh

description: The configured untrusted endpoint capacity lower threshold
percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityLowerThresh

description: The trap will be generated when the number of untrusted endpoints
on the Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer falls below the configured
threshold.

event.Summary: SLB untrusted endpoint capacity is within threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityThresholdClearTrap APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsCurrent u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsDenied u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsAgedOut u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacity u 9999 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityUpperThresh u 0 APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityLowerThresh u 0

description: Number of untrusted endpoints currently on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsCurrent

description: The number of untrusted endpoints denied by the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer due to the total number of
untrusted endpoints exceeding the configured maximum allowed.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsDenied

description: The number of untrusted endpoints aged out of the
system because they were not authenticated within the
configured grace period.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBStatsUntrustedEndpointsAgedOut

description: The maximum number of untrusted endpoints allowed on the
Subscriber-Aware Load Balancer. This value is a configured percentage
of the maximum endpoint capacity of the system.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacity

description: The configured untrusted endpoint capacity upper threshold
percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityUpperThresh

description: The configured untrusted endpoint capacity lower threshold
percentage.
variables.name: APSLB-MIB::apSLBUntrustedEndpointCapacityLowerThresh
